mdRecord.dcterms:description: Elmes died in 1847 and the work was continued by John Weightman, Corporation Surveyor, and Robert Rawlinson, structural engineer, until in 1851 Charles Cockerell was appointed architect. Cockerell was largely responsible for the decoration of the interiors. -- https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/St_George%27s_Hall,_Liverpool [work]
